channel.title: Ink language docs on .ink
channel.description: Recent content in Ink language docs on .ink

item.title: An overview of Ink
item.description: What’s Ink? Ink is a functional, general-purpose, interpreted scripting language. It’s dynamically and strongly typed. Ink programs can be web servers, short scripts, drawing programs, or anything else that interfaces with files and networks.

item.title: Open-source Ink projects
item.description: Projects Monocle Monocle is my universal, personal search engine. It can query across tens of thousands of documents from my blog posts, journal entries, notes, Tweets, contacts, and more to act as my extended memory spanning my entire life.

item.title: Runtime and builtins
item.description: Operating system interfaces Many system interface builtin functions are designed around asynchronous callbacks, and will return an event object to a callback function in response.

item.title: Standard library reference
item.description: The Ink standard library is not current packaged into the distributed binary. However, you can get up-to-date versions of these libraries on GitHub. Standard (std) std is Ink’s core library.
